result.execSummary:
The defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm With Intent To Cause Bodily Harm) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: - Court sets restitution at $1200.00 payable to A.R.S., joint and several with co-defendant.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

- No contact with victim.
- No contact, must be at least 500 feet away from, the victim's residence.

- Provide a DNA sample.
- Complete an anger management therapy.
- Complete cognitive intervention programming.
- Stay off social media.

timeConds.notes:
- Serve 6 months condition time in the House of Correction; 30 days are stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
* Court grants Huber privileges for work.
* Report by 10/26/22 at 12:00 pm.

charges.descr: Substantial Battery (Substantial Bodily Harm With Intent To Cause Bodily Harm)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Savanna Lynn Heisler

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
22A 096972/reapplied to cost/surcharges.
22A 096969/reapplied to restitution as it is J&S

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Savanna Lynn Heisler.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 2: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS, credit for 7 days time served. The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR and 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:
- Serve 6 months condition time in the House of Correction; 30 days are stayed to be used at the discretion of the agent. 
* Court grants Huber privileges for work.
* Report by 10/26/22 at 12:00 pm.

- Provide a DNA sample. 
- Maintain full-time work or school or combination of both. 
- No contact with victim.
- No contact, must be at least 500 feet away from, the victim's residence.
- Complete 60 hours of community service. 
- Complete an anger management therapy.
- Complete cognitive intervention programming.
- Stay off social media.

- Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court sets restitution at $1200.00 payable to A.R.S., joint and several with co-defendant.
*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court denies request for expungement.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Savanna Lynn Heisler.  Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

Court reminded defendant of conditions of bail. Court vacates 10-03-2022 jury trial date. Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, Branch 36.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment
signed form
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Case called with co-defendant Lackershire 22CF200. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling Conference. Case called with co-defendant LACKERSHIRE 22CF200  Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned , Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective R. Mueller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed.

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court.  Patrick J Leigl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. All parties appear via zoom.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Indigency Hearing. Indigency Hearing proceeded. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Thomas E. Harris, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $125.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $30.00 per month beginning April 1, 2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Indigency hearing on February 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. Defendant is not eligible for SPD appointment and has not retained counsel. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.   Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/ed5b9ae0-0153-fff4-9924-88d8db5a37c1  Indigency hearing scheduled for February 11, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Savanna Lynn Heisler in custody.  Kaitlyn Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
